Result<T,E>

      public @NonNull E unwrapErr()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns the error value, throwing an exception if this is a success.

      This is the inverse of Result.unwrap().

      Specified by:

    • expect

      public @NonNull T expect(@NonNull String message)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns the success value if present, otherwise throws an exception with the given message.

      Similar to Result.unwrap(), but allows you to provide a custom error message for better debugging and error reporting. The error value is discarded.

      Specified by:
      expect in interface Result<T,E>
      Parameters:
      message - the error message to use if this is Err
      Returns:
      the wrapped value
      See Also:
      • for a version without custom message

    • expectErr

      public @NonNull E expectErr(@NonNull String message)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns the error value if present, otherwise throws an exception with the given message.

      This is the inverse of Result.expect(String). Use this when you're certain the operation failed and need to extract the error with a custom message.

      Specified by:
      expectErr in interface Result<T,E>
      Parameters:
      message - the error message to use if this is Ok
      Returns:
      the wrapped error
      See Also:
      • for a version without custom message

    • map

      public <U> @NonNull Result<U,E> map(@NonNull Function<T,U> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Transforms the success value by applying a function, if present.

      This is the primary way to transform values inside a Result without unwrapping and re-wrapping. If this is Err, the function is not called and the error is propagated unchanged.

      Specified by:
      map in interface Result<T,E>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the transformed value
      Parameters:
      fn - the function to apply to the success value
      Returns:
      Ok with the transformed value if this is Ok, otherwise Err unchanged
      See Also:
      • for transformations that return Results

    • mapErr

      Description copied from interface: Result
      Transforms the error value by applying a function, if present.
      Specified by:
      mapErr in interface Result<T,E>
      Type Parameters:
      F - the type of the new error
      Parameters:
      fn - the function to apply to the error value
      Returns:
      Ok unchanged if this is Ok, otherwise Err with the transformed error

    • and

      public <U> @NonNull Result<U,E> and(@NonNull Result<U,E> other)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns the provided Result if this is Ok, otherwise returns this Err.

      Implements logical AND behavior, both Results must succeed for the final result to succeed.

      Specified by:
      and in interface Result<T,E>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the other Result's success value
      Parameters:
      other - the Result to return if this is Ok
      Returns:
      other if this is Ok, otherwise this Err
      See Also:
      • for a lazy, function-based version

    • andThen

      public <U> @NonNull Result<U,E> andThen(@NonNull Function<T,Result<U,E>> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Applies a function that returns a Result if this is Ok, otherwise returns this Err.

      This is essentially an alias for Result.flatMap(Function), but emphasizes the sequencing/chaining aspect rather than the flattening behavior. The name comes from Rust's Result API.

      Specified by:
      andThen in interface Result<T,E>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of value in the returned Result
      Parameters:
      fn - the function to apply if this is Ok
      Returns:
      the result of applying the function if this is Ok, otherwise this Err
      See Also:
      • for the same behavior with different emphasis

    • or

      public @NonNull Result<T,E> or(@NonNull Result<T,E> other)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns this Result if it's Ok, otherwise returns the provided alternative.

      Implements logical OR behavior - returns the first successful Result. Use this for fallback strategies where you want to try alternative approaches if one fails.

      Specified by:
      or in interface Result<T,E>
      Parameters:
      other - the alternative Result to use if this is Err
      Returns:
      this Result if Ok, otherwise other
      See Also:
      • for a lazy version

    • orElse

      public @NonNull Result<T,E> orElse(@NonNull Supplier<Result<T,E>> supplier)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns this Result if it's Ok, otherwise computes an alternative.

      Lazy version of Result.or(Result). The supplier is only called if this Result is Err. Use this when the fallback is expensive to compute or has side effects.

      Specified by:
      orElse in interface Result<T,E>
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplier to call if this is Err
      Returns:
      this Result if Ok, otherwise the result of calling the supplier

    • ok

      public @NonNull Option<T> ok()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Converts this Result to an Option of the success value.

      Discards the error information and returns Some if successful, None if failed. Use this when you only care about whether the operation succeeded, not why it failed.

      Specified by:
      ok in interface Result<T,E>
      Returns:
      Some containing the success value if Ok, otherwise None
      See Also:
      • for converting to an Option of the error

    • err

      public @NonNull Option<E> err()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Converts this Result to an Option of the error value.

      Discards the success information and returns Some if failed, None if successful. Use this when you want to collect or process errors while ignoring successes.

      Specified by:
      err in interface Result<T,E>
      Returns:
      Some containing the error value if Err, otherwise None
      See Also:
      • for converting to an Option of the success value

    • contains

      public boolean contains(@NonNull T value)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Returns true if this is Ok and contains the given value. For Ok: returns true if the wrapped value equals the given value For Err: returns false
      Specified by:
      contains in interface Result<T,E>
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • zip

      public <U> @NonNull Result<Pair<T,U>,E> zip(@NonNull Result<U,E> other)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Combines this Result with another, returning Ok only if both are Ok. For Ok(a) and Ok(b): returns Ok(Pair(a, b)) For any Err: returns the first Err encountered
      Specified by:
      zip in interface Result<T,E>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the other Result's Ok value
      Parameters:
      other - the Result to zip with
      Returns:
      Ok containing both values if both are Ok, otherwise the first Err

    • zipWith

      public <U, R> @NonNull Result<R,E> zipWith(@NonNull Result<U,E> other, @NonNull BiFunction<T,U,R> fn)
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Combines this Result with another using a combining function. For Ok(a) and Ok(b): returns Ok(fn(a, b)) For any Err: returns the first Err encountered
      Specified by:
      zipWith in interface Result<T,E>
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the other Result's Ok value
      R - the result type
      Parameters:
      other - the Result to zip with
      fn - the function to combine the values
      Returns:
      Ok with combined value if both are Ok, otherwise the first Err

    • transpose

      public <U> @NonNull Option<Result<U,E>> transpose()
      Description copied from interface: Result
      Transposes a Result of an Option into an Option of a Result. For Ok(Some(value)): returns Some(Ok(value)) For Ok(None): returns None For Err(error): returns Some(Err(error))
      Specified by:

      public final String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record class. The representation contains the name of the class, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this object. The value is derived from the hash code of each of the record components.
      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.

      the value of the error record component
